question:
With respect to the recent success in using an anti-viral cocktail to control the novel coronavirus, consider the following statements:
  1. Anti-HIV drugs were used in the treatment.
  2. Oseltamivir, one of the components of the cocktail, is used for treating influenza.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Thai doctors had recently reported success in controlling coronavirus induced symptoms using an anti-viral cocktail containing anti-HIV drugs and drug used to treat flu. Ritonavir and lopinavir are the two anti-HIV drugs included in the combination which successfully improved the condition of a 71 year old patient in Thailand.  Statement 2 is correct: The drug combination contains oseltamivir which is an anti-flu drug used for treating influenza A and influenza B. Oseltamivir is commonly called ‘Tamiflu’. It was famously used for the tackling the H5N1 outbreak in India. Recently, the novel coronavirus claimed its first victim outside China- in Philippines.
